result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Wells

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antonio Wells in court.  Attorney Carl W Knepel in court for Antonio Wells.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel.  
IA reset to 11-21-2022 at 1:30pm
Initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:07 PM Defendant Antonio Wells appeared by video.  Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Antonio Wells.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant appears, via zoom, voluntarily, on warrant.  Initial appearance is set for 10-17-2022 at 1:30pm.  Previously furnished recognizance bond is continued along with any conditions.
Warrant cancelled.

Defendant Antonio Wells not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failed to appear for initial appearance.
Arrest warrant authorized.
RE: Felony bail jumping and Operate Vehicle w/o Owner's Consent on 09-23-2022.
Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping and operate motor vehicle w/o owner's consent.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 10-10-2022 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 1.  Bail is set at $3,000 recognizance bond with the conditions that he is to have no contact with Taneekja Wellner or Tivon Wells.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
